title: Frontend Developer
description_markdown:
Santa Monica, CA
 
 Company Background



 Pollenly is a Science Inc. portfolio company founded in 2019 by a team of digital consultants and sales experts with founders that have previously been national leaders of Deloitte Digital and Equinox Fitness. Pollenly is built to help brands grow their social media e-commerce revenue. It is a B2B platform that optimizes end-to-end solutions that provide brands all necessary technological resources to improve affiliate online sales by providing more transparency on ROI. Previous to our company, brands had to use external links or reference codes to track affiliate sales on social media and their influencers. However, Pollenly’s platform provides its partners increased efficiency, more accuracy, improved backend support and has put the buyer’s trust back in influencer marketing. Our team is committed to helping the people who make up our partner brands grow as successful and influential leaders. We’re proud to say that with our platform and support makes us the optimal solution to the ecommerce market. For more details, please visit https://www.pollenly.com.
 
 Position Summary



 We are looking for a talented and experienced individual to join our team as a Frontend Developer. The Frontend Developer will be focused on developing our Pollenly mobile apps and web technology. You’ll play an essential role in the development and improvement of our platform by streamlining processes and communications for our users. By becoming intimate with our product offerings, collaborating with our other tech team members and receiving end user feedback, you will be providing key insights into our development efforts. You will be working with a close knit crew of talented individuals and report directly to the CTO.
 

 You must have a strong comfort level in helping shape and grow our tech team and building best practices and processes to continue to scale our growth. You’ll have the unique opportunity to join our rapidly growing company in a role where your work and efforts will have a direct impact on our users and your peers.
 
 Responsibilities



 Work closely with other developers on creating an end-to-end product
 

 Suggest limitations and find solutions to blockages on major alterations
 

 Will work with all core devs on getting projects completed
 

 Design, develop, and deliver product features and improvements.
 

 Architect components for implementation in front-end technologies.
 

 Work with business partners to evaluate feasibility of new features.
 

 Plan implementation and ensure timely execution.
 

 Review code and output of engineering peers.
 

 Obtains tasks from the project lead or and prepares functional and design specifications.
 

 Responsible for resolving crisis situations within his/her AOR.
 

 Initiates and conducts code reviews, creates code standards, conventions and guidelines.
 

 Suggests technical and functional improvements to add value to the product.
 

 Develop new features and enhancements aligned with business needs.
 

 Perform technical research and suggest best practice.
 

 Present new technology to management.
 

 Qualifications



 B.S. in Computer Science or Software Engineering
 

 3+ years of experience with: HTML/CSS5, Javascript, React, Sketch, UX/UI, SaaS, JEST testing framework, AWS, MongoDB
 

 Experience with e-commerce platforms (i.e., Shopify, Magento, Woocommerce)
 

 Extensive knowledge of object-oriented architectural and design patterns
 

 Experience working with complex database schemas
 

 Motivation, ambition, and strong communication and collaboration skills
 

 Strong analytical & problem solving skills.
 

 Apply Now

 Please email us your resume and cover letter 
 careers@pollenly.com

title: Web Developer II (Remote)
description_markdown:
About the job
---------------



 
**The Company**Rescue is a full-service marketing agency with a mission to make healthy behaviors easier and more appealing. Since our founding in 2001, Rescue has been exclusively focused on researching, developing, and implementing positive social change campaigns in public health. We provide research, strategy, creative, production, web, traditional media, social media, policy change, youth engagement and experiential marketing services to government, non-profit, and healthcare clients in over 25 states and provinces, as well as to federal government agencies.  

  

Rescue’s health behavior change marketing campaigns focus on topics such as tobacco, obesity, substance and alcohol prevention; the promotion of exercise, eating healthy foods, early childhood development, and after school programs; and other topics that promote healthy living. Rescue’s behavior change campaigns focus on diverse populations within teen (13 - 17), young adult (18 - 26), and adult (18+) populations in both rural and urban areas, resulting in a wide variety of campaign styles and strategies.  

  

We believe that marketing can do more than sell goods, it can create good, and we are looking for team members that are ready to work hard to create a healthier world.  

  

**The Job**Rescue Agency is seeking an experienced and well-rounded Web Developer II to expand our award-winning team and aid in the development of cutting-edge websites for various audiences within the public health space.  

  

We are looking for a person with excellent creative judgment and technical knowledge to develop engaging digital and web experiences. A person who can effectively communicate with creatives and non-creatives alike; with the ability to take direction and feedback from multiple sources to create cohesive and compelling websites. Someone with a proven ability to consistently deliver polished, professional work within the project scope.  

  

This is an ideal position for anyone who enjoys working on challenging projects with other highly talented individuals. Applicants must be comfortable in a fast-paced, deadline and deliverables-driven setting.  

  

**Day-To-Day Activities*** Own the role of web development lead on team projects, collaborate to develop websites and digital experiences;
* Participate in project kick-off and status meetings with creative and other project leaders. Proactively communicate ideas and creative solutions;
* Collaborate effectively and closely with strategists, writers, designers, developers, product managers, and QA Team to refine and improve the user experience;
* Expertly translate high-fidelity designs into working websites;
* Lead development and execution of websites on time and on strategy;
* Handle multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment;
* Provide quality assurance and attention to detail;
* Utilize internal tracking systems and procedures;
* Contribute to continuously improving team productivity, code quality, tool, and technology adoption;
* Other duties as required;

**Required Qualifications*** High School Diploma/GED
* 3+ years of industry experience
* Ability to creatively apply technology to solve problems
* Ability to analyze requirements and implement a solution with little guidance
* Good eye for aesthetics and attention to detail
* Experience writing clean, semantic, and reusable code
* Experience working with component-based architecture
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to adjust to changing environments and switch contexts during development
* Flexibility and willingness to learn and perform a variety of tasks
* Expertise in Vue 2 (we primarily use Nuxt.js to build sites)
* Understanding of web animation and various implementation methods
* Strong familiarity with Git
* Strong command line expertise
* Experience using AWS for site hosting and deployments
* Experience working with legacy codebases, CMSes, and databases
* Familiarity with PHP (Laravel) and MySQL

**Preferred Qualifications*** Agency experience is strongly preferred
* Expertise in getting the most out of Nuxt.js
* Experience with or desire to work with Vue 3
* Experience using JIRA as part of a development workflow
* Solid understanding of relational database structure
* Understanding of SEO principles
* Familiarity with GraphQL
* Experience with data visualization libraries
* Experience using canvas, WebGL, or any other advanced animation techniques
* Experience with managing npm packages
* Experience with implementing solutions that are also compatible with IE
* Experience using DigitalOcean for site hosting and deployments

**Location:** Rescue is a remote work-friendly employer. With limited exceptions, remote work is allowed on a case-by-case basis. Please contact Careers@RescueAgency.com if you have any questions.  

  

**Status:** Full-time  

  

**Benefits:** Learn more about the benefits of working at Rescue here: http://rescueagency.com/careers/  

  

**Travel:** None  

  

If you’re ready to join our team of mission driven talent challenging the status quo, we’d love to meet you! Check out our Careers page at rescueagency.com/careers for more information about what it’s like to work at Rescue, and the benefits that we offer to our team members.  

  

**The Fine Print  

  

**Environment**All business-related environments are tobacco-free.  

  

**COVID-19 Vaccine Mandate**All employees hired must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their first day of employment. This includes employees who telecommute and work remotely. For Pfizer or Moderna, that is two weeks after an employee has received the second dose in a 2-dose primary series. For Johnson and Johnson (J&J)/Janssen, that is two weeks after an employee has received a primary single-dose.  

  

**Physical Requirements**Able to remain in a sitting position for prolonged periods of time and stoop, bend, reach, climb stairs, and move freely throughout the building for the performance of duties. Able to read from a computer or laptop monitor for several hours at a time including fonts of various sizes from a variety of sources. Able to travel nationwide as needed to meet with clients, coworkers, or attend meetings and seminars.  

  

**The Application**All applications must be submitted through Rescue’s online careers system (unless you qualify to request a reasonable accommodation, as detailed at RescueAgency.com/careers). We do not accept applications via email, mail, fax or in-person delivery. Please send questions to careers@rescueagency.com. All applicants must include links to an online portfolio or to direct examples of past work, where applicable. Applications without portfolio links will not be reviewed.  

  

PLEASE NOTE: All email correspondence that you receive from Rescue Agency will be sent through an ‘@rescueagency.com’ email address. We recommend that you disregard any emails posing as authentic Rescue Agency accounts (e.g. @rescueaggency.com or rescueagency.jobs@gmail.com). If you receive a message from a Rescue employee, you can verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us at careers@rescueagency.com.  

  

**Rescue | The Behavior Change Agency is an EEO/Minority/Female/Disability/Protected Veteran Employer** **#REMOTE****

High School Diploma/GED3+ years of industry experienceAbility to creatively apply technology to solve problems Ability to analyze requirements and implement a solution with little guidanceGood eye for aesthetics and attention to detail Experience writing clean, semantic, and reusable codeExperience working with component-based architectureStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to adjust to changing environments and switch contexts during developmentFlexibility and willingness to learn and perform a variety of tasksExpertise in Vue 2 (we primarily use Nuxt.js to build sites)Understanding of web animation and various implementation methodsStrong familiarity with GitStrong command line expertiseExperience using AWS for site hosting and deploymentsExperience working with legacy codebases, CMSes, and databasesFamiliarity with PHP (Laravel) and MySQL
Preferred Qualifications
Agency experience is strongly preferredExpertise in getting the most out of Nuxt.jsExperience with or desire to work with Vue 3Experience using JIRA as part of a development workflowSolid understanding of relational database structureUnderstanding of SEO principlesFamiliarity with GraphQLExperience with data visualization librariesExperience using canvas, WebGL, or any other advanced animation techniquesExperience with managing npm packagesExperience with implementing solutions that are also compatible with IEExperience using DigitalOcean for site hosting and deployments 
Location: Rescue is a remote work-friendly employer. With limited exceptions, remote work is allowed on a case-by-case basis. Please contact Careers@RescueAgency.com if you have any questions.

Status: Full-time

Benefits: Learn more about the benefits of working at Rescue here: http://rescueagency.com/careers/

Travel: None

If you’re ready to join our team of mission driven talent challenging the status quo, we’d love to meet you! Check out our Careers page at rescueagency.com/careers for more information about what it’s like to work at Rescue, and the benefits that we offer to our team members.

The Fine Print

Environment

All business-related environments are tobacco-free.

COVID-19 Vaccine Mandate

All employees hired must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their first day of employment. This includes employees who telecommute and work remotely. For Pfizer or Moderna, that is two weeks after an employee has received the second dose in a 2-dose primary series. For Johnson and Johnson (J&J)/Janssen, that is two weeks after an employee has received a primary single-dose.

Physical Requirements

Able to remain in a sitting position for prolonged periods of time and stoop, bend, reach, climb stairs, and move freely throughout the building for the performance of duties. Able to read from a computer or laptop monitor for several hours at a time including fonts of various sizes from a variety of sources. Able to travel nationwide as needed to meet with clients, coworkers, or attend meetings and seminars.

The Application

All applications must be submitted through Rescue’s online careers system (unless you qualify to request a reasonable accommodation, as detailed at RescueAgency.com/careers). We do not accept applications via email, mail, fax or in-person delivery. Please send questions to careers@rescueagency.com. All applicants must include links to an online portfolio or to direct examples of past work, where applicable. Applications without portfolio links will not be reviewed.

PLEASE NOTE: All email correspondence that you receive from Rescue Agency will be sent through an ‘@rescueagency.com’ email address. We recommend that you disregard any emails posing as authentic Rescue Agency accounts (e.g. @rescueaggency.com or rescueagency.jobs@gmail.com). If you receive a message from a Rescue employee, you can verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us at careers@rescueagency.com.

Rescue | The Behavior Change Agency is an EEO/Minority/Female/Disability/Protected Veteran Employer

 #REMOTE
description_html:
About the job

The Company

Rescue is a full-service marketing agency with a mission to make healthy behaviors easier and more appealing. Since our founding in 2001, Rescue has been exclusively focused on researching, developing, and implementing positive social change campaigns in public health. We provide research, strategy, creative, production, web, traditional media, social media, policy change, youth engagement and experiential marketing services to government, non-profit, and healthcare clients in over 25 states and provinces, as well as to federal government agencies.

Rescue’s health behavior change marketing campaigns focus on topics such as tobacco, obesity, substance and alcohol prevention; the promotion of exercise, eating healthy foods, early childhood development, and after school programs; and other topics that promote healthy living. Rescue’s behavior change campaigns focus on diverse populations within teen (13 - 17), young adult (18 - 26), and adult (18+) populations in both rural and urban areas, resulting in a wide variety of campaign styles and strategies.

We believe that marketing can do more than sell goods, it can create good, and we are looking for team members that are ready to work hard to create a healthier world.

The Job

Rescue Agency is seeking an experienced and well-rounded Web Developer II to expand our award-winning team and aid in the development of cutting-edge websites for various audiences within the public health space.

We are looking for a person with excellent creative judgment and technical knowledge to develop engaging digital and web experiences. A person who can effectively communicate with creatives and non-creatives alike; with the ability to take direction and feedback from multiple sources to create cohesive and compelling websites. Someone with a proven ability to consistently deliver polished, professional work within the project scope.

This is an ideal position for anyone who enjoys working on challenging projects with other highly talented individuals. Applicants must be comfortable in a fast-paced, deadline and deliverables-driven setting.

Day-To-Day Activities
  • Own the role of web development lead on team projects, collaborate to develop websites and digital experiences;
  • Participate in project kick-off and status meetings with creative and other project leaders. Proactively communicate ideas and creative solutions;
  • Collaborate effectively and closely with strategists, writers, designers, developers, product managers, and QA Team to refine and improve the user experience;
  • Expertly translate high-fidelity designs into working websites;
  • Lead development and execution of websites on time and on strategy;
  • Handle multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment;
  • Provide quality assurance and attention to detail;
  • Utilize internal tracking systems and procedures;
  • Contribute to continuously improving team productivity, code quality, tool, and technology adoption;
  • Other duties as required;
Required Qualifications
  • High School Diploma/GED
  • 3+ years of industry experience
  • Ability to creatively apply technology to solve problems
  • Ability to analyze requirements and implement a solution with little guidance
  • Good eye for aesthetics and attention to detail
  • Experience writing clean, semantic, and reusable code
  • Experience working with component-based architecture
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to adjust to changing environments and switch contexts during development
  • Flexibility and willingness to learn and perform a variety of tasks
  • Expertise in Vue 2 (we primarily use Nuxt.js to build sites)
  • Understanding of web animation and various implementation methods
  • Strong familiarity with Git
  • Strong command line expertise
  • Experience using AWS for site hosting and deployments
  • Experience working with legacy codebases, CMSes, and databases
  • Familiarity with PHP (Laravel) and MySQL
Preferred Qualifications
  • Agency experience is strongly preferred
  • Expertise in getting the most out of Nuxt.js
  • Experience with or desire to work with Vue 3
  • Experience using JIRA as part of a development workflow
  • Solid understanding of relational database structure
  • Understanding of SEO principles
  • Familiarity with GraphQL
  • Experience with data visualization libraries
  • Experience using canvas, WebGL, or any other advanced animation techniques
  • Experience with managing npm packages
  • Experience with implementing solutions that are also compatible with IE
  • Experience using DigitalOcean for site hosting and deployments
Location: Rescue is a remote work-friendly employer. With limited exceptions, remote work is allowed on a case-by-case basis. Please contact Careers@RescueAgency.com if you have any questions.

Status: Full-time

Benefits: Learn more about the benefits of working at Rescue here: http://rescueagency.com/careers/

Travel: None

If you’re ready to join our team of mission driven talent challenging the status quo, we’d love to meet you! Check out our Careers page at rescueagency.com/careers for more information about what it’s like to work at Rescue, and the benefits that we offer to our team members.

The Fine Print

Environment

All business-related environments are tobacco-free.

COVID-19 Vaccine Mandate

All employees hired must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their first day of employment. This includes employees who telecommute and work remotely. For Pfizer or Moderna, that is two weeks after an employee has received the second dose in a 2-dose primary series. For Johnson and Johnson (J&J)/Janssen, that is two weeks after an employee has received a primary single-dose.

Physical Requirements

Able to remain in a sitting position for prolonged periods of time and stoop, bend, reach, climb stairs, and move freely throughout the building for the performance of duties. Able to read from a computer or laptop monitor for several hours at a time including fonts of various sizes from a variety of sources. Able to travel nationwide as needed to meet with clients, coworkers, or attend meetings and seminars.

The Application

All applications must be submitted through Rescue’s online careers system (unless you qualify to request a reasonable accommodation, as detailed at RescueAgency.com/careers). We do not accept applications via email, mail, fax or in-person delivery. Please send questions to careers@rescueagency.com. All applicants must include links to an online portfolio or to direct examples of past work, where applicable. Applications without portfolio links will not be reviewed.

PLEASE NOTE: All email correspondence that you receive from Rescue Agency will be sent through an ‘@rescueagency.com’ email address. We recommend that you disregard any emails posing as authentic Rescue Agency accounts (e.g. @rescueaggency.com or rescueagency.jobs@gmail.com). If you receive a message from a Rescue employee, you can verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us at careers@rescueagency.com.

title: Frontend Developer #LI- Remote
description_markdown:
Scratch Financial ("Scratchpay") is a financial technology startup based in Los Angeles, California. Our goal is to make difficult financial decisions simple and increase accessibility to fair, affordable, and transparent medical financing. Driven by our award-winning technology, Scratchpay has become the fastest growing financing provider in veterinary care, with our payment plans now offered in over 10,000 practices across the U.S. and Canada–ranging from dental offices to optometry clinics. We’re rapidly launching a new Point-of-Sale payment processing suite to help our providers create a better payments experience for their patients.
 


  
 If putting compassion first, helping create groundbreaking products and continuously iterating & refining those products sound like you, then we encourage you to apply.
 


  
 We’re looking for a Frontend Developer with good experience with UI/UX design to join the engineering team at Scratch Financial, Inc. Scratch Financial is on a mission to help people and their loved ones live happier lives by making access to healthcare simple. Over 1 million people have already turned to Scratch Financial products to help them get the care they need today, and pay for medical treatment over time. Interested in helping visualize and build digital experiences that help simplify patient financing and help people live happier and healthier lives? Then read on…
 


  
 The ideal candidate will have experience in User Interface Development and have a passion for creating User Interfaces for financial technology brands and services. The ideal candidate will be someone that is innovative, adaptable to changing priorities, a system thinker, and able to learn new things while striving to deliver high quality code.
 


  
 We encourage you to apply even if you feel you do not perfectly fit our job description, we’re always looking for talent, and there may be other positions at Scratch Financial you’re a match for.
 


  
 Salary range: $55K - $90K
 
###  **Strengths we’re looking for in you:**


* You have strong organizational skills and strong attention to detail.
* You learn and course correct when you don’t get the results you want.
* You are obsessed with eliminating friction within our digital experiences.
* You love doing things efficiently.


###  **Values you can expect from us:**


* We believe in small teams. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management and more getting things done.
* We hold true to our Scratch Values that enable a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment.
* We care most about getting it right rather than being right.


###  **Responsibilities**


* You will be responsible for designing and developing front end web architecture, testing your solutions, collaborating with Design & Brand, Product, Sales & Marketing, and Business Operation teams to build customer experience, and ensure your work’s ongoing responsiveness. Knowledge of financial apps is a bonus.
* Discuss, create, and implement User Interfaces within the Scratch Financial ecosystem. From simple sign-up forms to complex client management systems. There is no limit to what the business needs, and there is no limit to how good our solutions can be.
* Help Scratch develop its test infrastructure and write tests to improve Scratch’s test coverage.
* Participate in all technical and product discussions together with the team.
* Work with 100% quality and business-sustainability in mind.
* Developing front end website architecture.
* Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.
* Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
* Working alongside our Design & Brand, Product, Sales & Marketing, and Business Operation teams for building out customer experience and product development.
* Following a project from conception to finished product.
* Meeting both technical and consumer needs.
* Staying current on developments in web applications and programming languages, and helping Scratch adapt to any industry changes.


###  **Expected Qualifications**


* At least 3 years of full-time experience with software development.
* At least 2 years of hands-on experience with JavaScript UI frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue, Ionic, or Stencil.
* Some experience with Node.js.
* Good understanding of Object-Oriented Programming and development patterns.
* Some experience with microservice based architecture.
* Good coding skills, and ability to use BDD and TDD.
* Experience and understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency with fundamental front end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
* Ability to switch between languages and frameworks, not vendor-locked-in.
* Knowing what Agile and Scrum are.
* Fluent in English.
* Nice to have: design or arts education.
* Nice to have: experience developing mobile apps.
* Nice to have: knowledge of Google Cloud, GitLab, CI/CD, Kubernetes, and Docker.
* Nice to have: Experience in building payment processing solutions.
* Nice to have: Experience in loans business.


###  **Other Desired Qualities**


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Obsessed at delivering high quality work.
* Great problem-solving skills.
* Attention to detail.
* Forward-thinking and innovative.
* Respectful.
* Hardworking.
* Have empathy.
* Know your stuff and know what you don't know.
* Take constructive criticism.
* Collaborative Team Player.
* Open to change.



 Scratchpay is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Scratchpay considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

+ Nice to have: Experience in loans business.






### **Other Desired Qualities**


+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
+ Obsessed at delivering high quality work.
+ Great problem-solving skills.
+ Attention to detail.
+ Forward-thinking and innovative.
+ Respectful.
+ Hardworking.
+ Have empathy.
+ Know your stuff and know what you don't know.
+ Take constructive criticism.
+ Collaborative Team Player.
+ Open to change.






 Scratchpay is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Scratchpay considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
description_text:
Scratch Financial ("Scratchpay") is a financial technology startup based in Los Angeles, California. Our goal is to make difficult financial decisions simple and increase accessibility to fair, affordable, and transparent medical financing. Driven by our award-winning technology, Scratchpay has become the fastest growing financing provider in veterinary care, with our payment plans now offered in over 10,000 practices across the U.S. and Canada–ranging from dental offices to optometry clinics. We’re rapidly launching a new Point-of-Sale payment processing suite to help our providers create a better payments experience for their patients.
  


 If putting compassion first, helping create groundbreaking products and continuously iterating & refining those products sound like you, then we encourage you to apply.
  


 We’re looking for a Frontend Developer with good experience with UI/UX design to join the engineering team at Scratch Financial, Inc. Scratch Financial is on a mission to help people and their loved ones live happier lives by making access to healthcare simple. Over 1 million people have already turned to Scratch Financial products to help them get the care they need today, and pay for medical treatment over time. Interested in helping visualize and build digital experiences that help simplify patient financing and help people live happier and healthier lives? Then read on…
  


 The ideal candidate will have experience in User Interface Development and have a passion for creating User Interfaces for financial technology brands and services. The ideal candidate will be someone that is innovative, adaptable to changing priorities, a system thinker, and able to learn new things while striving to deliver high quality code.
  


 We encourage you to apply even if you feel you do not perfectly fit our job description, we’re always looking for talent, and there may be other positions at Scratch Financial you’re a match for.
  


 Salary range: $55K - $90K
  



Strengths we’re looking for in you:


 You have strong organizational skills and strong attention to detail.
 You learn and course correct when you don’t get the results you want.
 You are obsessed with eliminating friction within our digital experiences.
 You love doing things efficiently.






Values you can expect from us:


 We believe in small teams. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management and more getting things done.
 We hold true to our Scratch Values that enable a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment.
 We care most about getting it right rather than being right.






Responsibilities


 You will be responsible for designing and developing front end web architecture, testing your solutions, collaborating with Design & Brand, Product, Sales & Marketing, and Business Operation teams to build customer experience, and ensure your work’s ongoing responsiveness. Knowledge of financial apps is a bonus.
 Discuss, create, and implement User Interfaces within the Scratch Financial ecosystem. From simple sign-up forms to complex client management systems. There is no limit to what the business needs, and there is no limit to how good our solutions can be.
 Help Scratch develop its test infrastructure and write tests to improve Scratch’s test coverage.
 Participate in all technical and product discussions together with the team.
 Work with 100% quality and business-sustainability in mind.
 Developing front end website architecture.
 Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.
 Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
 Working alongside our Design & Brand, Product, Sales & Marketing, and Business Operation teams for building out customer experience and product development.
 Following a project from conception to finished product.
 Meeting both technical and consumer needs.
 Staying current on developments in web applications and programming languages, and helping Scratch adapt to any industry changes.






Expected Qualifications


 At least 3 years of full-time experience with software development.
 At least 2 years of hands-on experience with JavaScript UI frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue, Ionic, or Stencil.
 Some experience with Node.js.
 Good understanding of Object-Oriented Programming and development patterns.
 Some experience with microservice based architecture.
 Good coding skills, and ability to use BDD and TDD.
 Experience and understanding of RESTful APIs.
 Proficiency with fundamental front end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
 Ability to switch between languages and frameworks, not vendor-locked-in.
 Knowing what Agile and Scrum are.
 Fluent in English.
 Nice to have: design or arts education.
 Nice to have: experience developing mobile apps.
 Nice to have: knowledge of Google Cloud, GitLab, CI/CD, Kubernetes, and Docker.
 Nice to have: Experience in building payment processing solutions.
 Nice to have: Experience in loans business.






Other Desired Qualities 


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 Obsessed at delivering high quality work.
 Great problem-solving skills.
 Attention to detail.
 Forward-thinking and innovative.
 Respectful.
 Hardworking.
 Have empathy.
 Know your stuff and know what you don't know.
 Take constructive criticism.
 Collaborative Team Player.
 Open to change.






   Scratchpay is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Scratchpay considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

description_markdown:
Stord is on a mission to migrate supply chains to the cloud—empowering brands to build sophisticated, agile, and integrated supply chains.


 Founded in 2015 and headquartered in the heart of Atlanta's vibrant tech community, Stord is pioneering the world's first Cloud Supply Chain. The Cloud Supply Chain is the convergence of the digital and physical elements of logistics. With Stord's Cloud Supply Chain, businesses can build, expand, and optimize their physical supply chain operations across freight, warehousing, and fulfillment, with the speed, flexibility, and ease of modern cloud software.


 With a single integration, businesses achieve end-to-end visibility into their whole supply chains from a single dashboard and gain access to Stord's network of hundreds of warehouses, fulfillment centers, and carriers.


 We're a rapidly growing team that is backed by over $125M from leading investors such as Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, BOND, D1 Capital, and more (investors in Amazon, Google, Twitter, and more)We've received awards and recognition from TechCrunch, the Wall Street Journal, VentureBeat, Fortune, Forbes, Inc., TAG, Atlanta Business Chronicle, and more.


 The future of supply chains is in the cloud. Come help us help businesses out-deliver their competition with the Cloud Supply Chain.



 **About the Front-End Engineer Position:**


 We are looking for a talented Front-End Engineer with 5+ years' experience to accelerate front-end development through rapid prototyping and reusable components, and ensure highly testable and quality front-end solutions.


  


 **What You'll Do:**


* Build components as a part of our core design language to be consumed by all our teams as they rapidly iterate on product development
* Ensure components match our Design system's theme and styles
* Embed and support team efforts to design and develop product experiences requiring additional frontend guidance or support
* Enhance and maintain the toolchain that enables rapid development of frontends, including dev, test, build and deployment tooling and instrumentation
* Support efforts for developing frontends in isolation with code quality checks and tests
* Maintain Frontend Tooling for development, test, build, and deployment
* Collaborate with Design and engineering teams to ensure rapid development of quality frontend experience leveraging UI components and our design framework


  


 **What You'll Need:**


* 5+ years of Software Engineering with a focus in Front-End technologies
* Experience building React components and matching the themes and styles in our design system
* Strong in React.Js, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS and backend development skills
* Production experience in modern javascript toolchain for single-page applications, including react, npm, webpack, typescript, jest, and cypress
* Strong knowledge of and experience with CSS best practices and approaches, including System UI and Styled Systems, CSS modules, BEM, atomic CSS
* Proven track record taking features from wireframe to production
* Implement user experiences that include creating progressive enhancement and responsive design strategies; a penchant for avoiding the fickle parts of CSS to ease maintenance
* Proactive Problem-Solving; Organized; Strategic Thinker; Team-Oriented; and Enthusiasm for Relationship Building



 **Culture Snapshot:**


 Our team is passionate about sitting at the intersection of enterprise technology and global logistics. The STORD company culture is electric, and we are proud to offer a career experience that will make you excited to come to work every day. We are creating an environment of continuous improvement through collaboration and diverse thinking by solving challenging problems and working with talented and smart colleagues. At STORD you will have daily opportunities to learn and inspire those around you. You will be surrounded by a team of self-starters who are motivated to have an impact through driving results.


 Below are a few perks of joining our team:


* Competitive salary
* Friendly, Passionate, and Intelligent Employee Base
* Creative Problem Solving and Entrepreneurial Thinking
* Fast-Paced Environment
* Low-Ego, Solution-Driven Culture
* Community Involvement and Volunteer Opportunities
* Catered Lunches
* Ping Pong!


**Benefits:**


* 401(k)
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Life and Disability Insurance
* Health Savings Account (HSA) option
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - Mental Health Resources
* Paid Parental Leave
* Commuter Benefits
* Gym Stipend
* Flexible PTO
* Paid holidays
* And more!


*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: Lead Front End Developer — Remote
benefits: Dental insurance, Health insurance, Paid time off, Vision insurance
description_markdown:
**Who we are:**
---------------


 Tinuiti is a performance and data-driven digital marketing leader, focused on every aspect of the customer journey across the quadropoly of Google, Facebook/Instagram, Amazon, Apple, and beyond. We believe success requires specialization across all channels, and our offerings cover the full spectrum from paid to earned to owned media. Our goal when we come to work every day is simple - to grow happiness. For our clients, their customers, our people and our partners. Growing happiness guides everything we do and our core values - **Unleash Greatness, Never Stop Learning, Ignite Your Passion, Thankful Living, and Inspire Innovation & Change** - inspire us to maintain a culture where our people take pride in their work and have fun doing it.


 **We support 100% remote work for applicants who reside in the United States and Canada.**


 **Why Product & Technology**
-----------------------------


 Tinuiti is hiring a Lead Front End Developer! We're looking for a motivated self-starter that can communicate clearly. You'll be working with product-focused scrum teams to drive best practices, mentor, and deliver features to internal teams and external customers. You will be responsible for bringing an increased difficulty to our front end apps, making sure that everything we put out is consistent, sophisticated, easy to use, and performant. As such, this is a critical position that will have a spectacular impact on Tinuiti's business going forward.


 **What you'll be doing:**
--------------------------


* Implement the features and user interfaces of Tinuiti products.
* Collaborate with our product and design teams to define feature specifications and timelines
* Design technical architecture and align across all frontend applications
* Develop systems and processes for UI that's shared across the application (and create documents for these processes)
* Lead the unification of the frontend by working closely with all team frontend leads
* Unite all frontend teams to share code, knowledge, takeaways
* Monitor and strive to improve test coverage
* Mentor other team members to support their personal and technical growth.
* Advocate for continuous improvements to a team's day-to-day processes and support a culture of learning.
* Keep up-to-date with the constantly evolving web development world and engage in technical discussion of new solutions and architectures
* Participate in design and code reviews.


**Competencies:**
-----------------


* Leader: drives a common vision for the frontend teams
* Mentor: Loves to help others get better
* Priority Setting: solid understanding of time/bandwidth of themselves and others; eliminates roadblocks and creates focus.
* Problem Solving: uses thorough logic and methods to tackle difficult problems with effective solutions.
* Decisive: Open to input but moves to action instead of waiting for consensus.


**Requirements:**
-----------------


* 5+ years experience in frontend web development
* 3+ years experience with React
* Experience writing technical design documents
* Can work autonomously and collaborate with other engineers
* Excited to lead, mentor, and learn
* Experience with UI design patterns, security, performance and usability
* Nice to have: Experience with GraphQL


**We'd love to hear from you if:**
----------------------------------


 Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you qualify, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to connect and see if you could be a great fit.


 **FLSA Classification****: Exempt**
------------------------------------


  


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.


 **Benefits:**
--------------


At Tinuiti, we want to ensure you have the time you need to rest and recharge. That's why Tinuitians have an estimated **70 days off per year** through our time off programs


* **Flexible PTO** : We encourage (but do not require) all employees to take at least 20 PTO days per year and a maximum of 40 PTO days annually subject to general parameters of Tinuiti's PTO usage policy
* **Holidays:** We offer 17 paid holidays, if one of your religious holidays is not covered, please by all means take advantage of your Flex PTO!
* **Flex Friday's**: Meetings are minimized and all Tinuitians have the option to start their weekend early at 1pm local time.
* **Owning Our Offline:** Clients are informed and all offices will be closed for 3 total weeks throughout the year to give everyone the chance to truly unplug.


**Workplace Flexibility**: Office or Remote? Your choice.


 **Healthcare:** Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & Disability, Flex Spending Accounts


 **Retirement:** Match up to 4% of your contributions at 100% with immediate vesting


 **Perks and Wellness:** **Fringe, Forma, Thankful giving, Equity**
-------------------------------------------------------------------


 **Learning and Development**: Bravely coaching session, Mentor program and more


 **Disclaimer**: This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. Tinuiti is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.


 **COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement:** Tinuiti requires anyone working onsite, visiting Tinuiti offices or attending company sponsored events to provide proof they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious accommodation is requested and approved by The People Team. Please reach out Recruiting@Tinuiti.com if you have questions or concerns about this policy and how it may apply to your candidacy for a role with Tinuiti. It is also our employees' duty to recognize the potential risks of vaccinations and consult with a medical professional to help in determining what is best for their health. Tinuiti reserves the right to update or modify this policy at any point in time.


 **Working Conditions**: Working indoors, sitting at a computer for extended periods of time, lifting no more than 10 pounds.

description_html:
Who we are:

Tinuiti is a performance and data-driven digital marketing leader, focused on every aspect of the customer journey across the quadropoly of Google, Facebook/Instagram, Amazon, Apple, and beyond. We believe success requires specialization across all channels, and our offerings cover the full spectrum from paid to earned to owned media. Our goal when we come to work every day is simple - to grow happiness. For our clients, their customers, our people and our partners. Growing happiness guides everything we do and our core values - Unleash Greatness, Never Stop Learning, Ignite Your Passion, Thankful Living, and Inspire Innovation & Change - inspire us to maintain a culture where our people take pride in their work and have fun doing it.

We support 100% remote work for applicants who reside in the United States and Canada.

Why Product & Technology

Tinuiti is hiring a Lead Front End Developer! We're looking for a motivated self-starter that can communicate clearly. You'll be working with product-focused scrum teams to drive best practices, mentor, and deliver features to internal teams and external customers. You will be responsible for bringing an increased difficulty to our front end apps, making sure that everything we put out is consistent, sophisticated, easy to use, and performant. As such, this is a critical position that will have a spectacular impact on Tinuiti's business going forward.

What you'll be doing:

  • Implement the features and user interfaces of Tinuiti products.
  • Collaborate with our product and design teams to define feature specifications and timelines
  • Design technical architecture and align across all frontend applications
  • Develop systems and processes for UI that's shared across the application (and create documents for these processes)
  • Lead the unification of the frontend by working closely with all team frontend leads
  • Unite all frontend teams to share code, knowledge, takeaways
  • Monitor and strive to improve test coverage
  • Mentor other team members to support their personal and technical growth.
  • Advocate for continuous improvements to a team's day-to-day processes and support a culture of learning.
  • Keep up-to-date with the constantly evolving web development world and engage in technical discussion of new solutions and architectures
  • Participate in design and code reviews.

Competencies:

  • Leader: drives a common vision for the frontend teams
  • Mentor: Loves to help others get better
  • Priority Setting: solid understanding of time/bandwidth of themselves and others; eliminates roadblocks and creates focus.
  • Problem Solving: uses thorough logic and methods to tackle difficult problems with effective solutions.
  • Decisive: Open to input but moves to action instead of waiting for consensus.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience in frontend web development
  • 3+ years experience with React
  • Experience writing technical design documents
  • Can work autonomously and collaborate with other engineers
  • Excited to lead, mentor, and learn
  • Experience with UI design patterns, security, performance and usability
  • Nice to have: Experience with GraphQL

We'd love to hear from you if:

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box.
